{"step_by_step_thinking": "Antischkow cells are red blood cells that have a characteristic appearance under the microscope. They are typically seen in certain conditions. To determine which conditions antischkow cells are not present in, we need to evaluate each option. 

A. Sickle cell anaemia: In sickle cell anaemia, antischkow cells are commonly seen. 
B. Iron deficiency anaemia: Antischkow cells are not typically associated with iron deficiency anaemia. 
C. Apthous ulcer: Apthous ulcers are not related to the presence or absence of antischkow cells. 
D. Herpes simplex: Herpes simplex infection does not have any direct association with antischkow cells. 

Based on this analysis, the condition in which antischkow cells are not present is iron deficiency anaemia.", "answer_choice": "B"}
